tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE firmware_updates (
    update_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    firmware_version TEXT,
    security_patch TEXT,
    update_date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE firmware_updates (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT NOT NULL,
    update_version VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    update_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    update_date DATE NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    device_model VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    device_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    last_update_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE firmware_updates (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    firmware_version VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    update_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    security_patch TEXT,
    CONSTRAINT fk_device FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES devices(id)
);

CREATE TABLE devices (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    manufacturer VARCHAR(50),
    purchase_date DATE,
    CONSTRAINT unique_device_name UNIQUE (device_name)
);

CREATE TABLE device_logs (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
    log_message TEXT NOT NULL,
    log_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    CONSTRAINT fk_device_log FOREIGN KEY (device_id) REFERENCES devices(id)
);

CREATE TABLE firmware_updates (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    firmware_version VARCHAR(50),
    update_date DATE,
    status VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE security_patches (
    patch_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    patch_name VARCHAR(100),
    patch_description TEXT,
    release_date DATE,
    is_applied BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(100),
    manufacturer VARCHAR(50),
    firmware_version VARCHAR(50),
    last_update DATE
)

CREATE TABLE device_log (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    log_message TEXT,
    log_date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE device_statuses (
    status_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    status VARCHAR(50),
    status_date DATE
)
